q: and Greg Walden , of Oregon, have reintroduced proposed legislation that would prohibit the Federal Communications Commission from requiring that broadcasters give free airtime to opposing sides on controversial issues, according to Fox News. The American people cherish freedom, especially freedom of speech and of the press, said Mike Pence ." Bringing back the Fairness Doctrine would amount to government control over political views expressed on the public airways. We must pass the Broadcaster Freedom Act and bury the Fairness Doctrine once and for all.

9:19 AM| This is the worst job I've seen the Fact Checker ever do. The rating is belied by facts provided in Fact Checker's own column. In 1998: In August 1998, Iraq said it was suspending cooperation with the inspectors... In November, Iraq reversed itself and said it would cooperate, but the cooperation was not forthcoming. [ ellipsis added] So there you have it, on two separate occasions, Saddam Hussein refused to cooperate with weapons inspectors present in his country. How does that not support Donald Rumsfeld 's claim? The fact
